definition: to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]

sentences.english: The teacher's question caught him flat-footed.
sentences.chinese: 老师的讯问使他仓皇失措。

sentences.english: He was disconcerted to discover that he had lost the papers.
sentences.chinese: 他发现自己遗失文件而惊慌失措。

sentences.english: You may even be panic-stricken because she looks bored.
sentences.chinese: 因为她似乎被闷着了，你甚至可能惊慌失措。

sentences.english: Still lost in times of trouble?
sentences.chinese: 还会在遇到困难的时候茫然失措吗？

sentences.english: When the fire broke out in the ship, Sally was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 当轮船忽然着火时，萨莉吓得惊慌失措。

sentences.english: His harried assistant witnesses the scene with dismay.
sentences.chinese: 被逼急的助理看到这种情形，显得惊慌失措。

sentences.english: They hurry-scurry hitched a white flag after we warned.
sentences.chinese: 我们发出警告之后，他们便惊慌失措地扯起了白旗。

sentences.english: I am in struck with panically the hour just the attention arrive the mouth Diao of is a cake of abruptly of meat.
sentences.chinese: 我在惊惶失措时才注意到嘴里叼的是一块硬生生的肉。

sentences.english: The interrogatory seemed to strike the honest magistrate all of a heAP.
sentences.chinese: 这场盘问似乎叫那正直的地方法官惊慌失措了。

sentences.english: Natasha, pale and panic - stricken, flew into the drawing-room .
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎脸色苍白，惊惶失措，她跑进客厅里去。

sentences.english: By 9.35pm guests there were trapped and in panic.
sentences.chinese: 晚间9点35分，惊慌失措的顾客们被困在酒店中。

sentences.english: He panics . Ender stored the information away for future reference.
sentences.chinese: 他惊慌失措，安德先记下这点留待以后。

sentences.english: But this is the summer, we stopped panicking.
sentences.chinese: 不过，就在这个夏季，我们不再惊慌失措。

sentences.english: The child was out of his wits with fright.
There was a stampede of panic - stricken crowd from the burning hotel.
sentences.chinese: 一群惊惶失措的人们，从失火的旅馆中跑了出来。

sentences.english: By this time Bertha was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 伯莎这时已恐慌得惊惶失措。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
variant of 張皇|张皇[zhang1 huang2]
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
